oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Johnson family postcard
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Postcard of the Johnson family, 45(?)01 Alabama, St. Elmo, Tennessee. Ca. 1909-1910. Real photograph postcard added to back of printed book. The information was provided by Penelope Johnson Allen.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Postcards; Families; African Americans; Yards;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Genealogy Of A Branch Of The Johnson Family And Connections. Compiled by E.M. Johnson, 1893.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: On back of postcard: Jim Montgomery our yard man & gardener, Helen Bryan, Foster Johnson, Mama (Sue C. Johnson), A.W. Johnson. Four Johnsons in front goat yard and house in rear. Circa 1909 or 1910. Back yard of 45(?)01 Alabama, St. Elmo, Tennessee.'
